summary: This document is a memo summarizing a call between an attorney and Jeanne Christensen regarding a new alleged victim of Leon Black. The victim claims she was violently sexually assaulted by Black in the early 2000s at Jeffrey Epstein's New York townhouse, where she worked giving massages. The memo details the assault, subsequent interactions with Black, and the victim's connection to Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: Attorney who received a call from an alleged victim and is communicating the details to another party. She is the sender/recipient of the emails and the subject of the memo.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Financier accused of violently sexually assaulting a woman at Epstein's townhouse in the early 2000s. Described as receiving massages and later giving the victim cash.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Met the victim at his NY townhouse, discussed her money problems, and introduced her to Leon Black. The alleged assault occurred at his property.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the victim met a number of times at Epstein's townhouse.

persons.name: Judge Preska
persons.context: Presiding judge in a Maxwell civil case (Case number 15 Cv. 7433) referenced in the context of unsealed phone messages.

connections.description: Black was introduced to the victim by Epstein at Epstein's townhouse. Epstein presented Black as someone who could help the victim get a job.
Black is alleged to have violently sexually assaulted the victim during a massage at Epstein's townhouse. He later contacted her, gave her cash, and met with her socially.
The victim worked giving massages at Epstein's townhouse for a few months. Epstein knew of her financial problems and paid her for massages.
Maxwell was present at Epstein's townhouse, where the victim met her on multiple occasions.
Christensen received a call from the alleged victim detailing the assault and is facilitating communication about the allegations.

events.title: Alleged Sexual Assault by Leon Black
events.description: A woman alleges she was violently sexually assaulted by Leon Black during a massage at Jeffrey Epstein's New York townhouse. The assault included biting.

events.title: Victim meets Epstein and Black
events.description: The victim met Jeffrey Epstein at his NY townhouse and was later introduced to Leon Black there by Epstein.

events.title: Flight to Florida with Black
events.description: Reference to a flight to Florida with Leon Black in September 2008, mentioned in the context of unsealed phone messages from Maxwell's civil case.

events.title: Initial Allegation Call to Christensen
events.description: Jeanne Christensen receives a call from a woman alleging Leon Black raped her years ago at Epstein's townhouse.

events.title: Memo to File Call Summary
events.description: A memo is created summarizing a call between an attorney and Jeanne Christensen to discuss the background of the allegations against Leon Black.

keyFacts: A new alleged victim came forward in August 2021 claiming Leon Black violently sexually assaulted her at Jeffrey Epstein's New York townhouse in the early 2000s.
The victim worked giving massages at Epstein's townhouse and was introduced to Black by Epstein, who suggested Black could help her get a job.
The assault is described in graphic detail, including Black biting the victim's vulva, labia, and clitoris, with the biting intensifying when she cried out in pain.
After the assault, Black contacted the victim, met her for drinks, and gave her an envelope containing $5,000 in cash.
The victim's account is noted as being strikingly similar to another client's allegations against Black, suggesting a pattern of specific violent behavior.
